description: Find out how much Chicago buildings pollute! This public tool helps citizens understand building emissions in the city.
Built with a modern Jamstack approach using Gridsome and Vue.

text.information: 69% of emissions in Chicago come from buildings according to the 2022 Chicago Climate Action Plan. Electrify Chicago is a Chi Hack Night project by led by Viktor Köves that transforms data into easy to understand analysis and charts so Chicagoans can understand the impact of their buildings on the climate.
Take the following buildings for example:
Marina Towers Condominiums - which we have given an overall grade of A for having low emissions intensity, is 100% electrified, and has consistently reported it’s energy use to the city.

Art Institute of Chicago - relies on 66% of it’s energy mix on natural gas, failed to report data for 2021, and emitted 19,08 tons of Co2e into the atmosphere, the 17th highest for buildings in Chicago.
We sourced emissions data from public records and aggregated them using Python and Pandas. The data pipeline ensures regular updates and accuracy.
